    How to add label printers to SupplyChain365

    This article is about adding label printers to the Supplychain365 Portal

    A label printer is a computerized device that prints on self-adhesive label sheets and label material. It is typically designed to be connected to a computer that has the necessary software to make up the label prints. Label printers are used in a wide range of applications, including logistics, retail, healthcare and warehousing.

    How to add a printer to the SupplyChain365 Portal:

    Click on components. Then click on printers to add a new printer. Here we have no printer at all. Let's click new and fill in the form: name, IP Address, port number, brand, model, description, and, if necessary, serial number. Then click save. A new printer has been added to the SupplyChain365 Portal and is ready to be used. Here you see a list of all the printers with complete information about the device, like name, IP address, port number, and brand. If you want to add a new printer, just click the new button with the plus icon. Here you can edit a printer's details, e.g. if you want to change the IP address or assign a new port number. In order to delete a printer, simply click delete.

    It is important that your device can connect the printer by IP and port directly in the network infrastructure.
